Name: Panama City
Description: Panama City is the capital of Panama.

Name: Balboa
Description: Balboa is the separated from Panama City by the Cerro Ancon (Ancon Hill), one of Panama City's skyline landmarks. Between the entrance of the Panama Canal and the City, it's the home of the Panama Canal Administration ACP [1], and part of the what was called "Canal Zone" when the Americans still ran the Canal. Now the official term is 'areas revertidas' or reverted areas.

Name: Boquete
Description: Boquete is a village in Chiriqui province, in the Pacific West of Panama.

Name: Boca Chica
Description: Boca Chica is a city in Gulf of Chiriquí.

Name: Colon (Panama)
Description: Colón is a city in Central Panama. The town is in poor condition and notorious for its high crime rate, but it is worth driving around to look at the culture, people and architecture.

Name: David (Panama)
Description: David is the capital city in the province of Chiriqui province in the Pacific West of Panama. It is on the Pan American Highway and is one of the most prosperous areas of Panama, with good infrastructure.

Name: Gamboa
Description: Gamboa is a small town in Central Panama.

Name: Portobelo
Description: Portobelo is a port city in Central Panama. It is located on the northern part of the Isthmus of Panama.

Name: Coiba National Marine Park
Description: Coiba National Marine Park in the Gulf of Chiriqui in the Pacific West of Panama.

Name: La Amistad International Park
Description: The La Amistad International Park, or in Spanish Parque Internacional La Amistad, formerly the La Amistad National Park, is an transboundary protected area in Latin America, management of which is shared between Costa Rica and Panama

Name: Parque Nacional Marino Golfo de Chiriquí
Description: Parque Nacional Marino Golfo de Chiriquí is a national park in the Gulf of Chiriquí in the Pacific West of Panama.

Name: El Valle
Description: El Valle de Anton is a town in Cocle province, Central Panama.

Name: Pearl Islands
Description: The Pearl Islands (Spanish: Archipielago de las Perlas) are a region in the Pacific ocean off the coast of Panama. Made famous as the site for three seasons of the reality television show Survivor, the archipelago is a combination of beautiful islands with pristine virgin forest and sandy white beaches. Contadora Island is the most developed one, with a paved airstrip and 2 high-end Resorts and many private houses.

Name: San Blas Islands
Description: The San Blas Islands is a group of islands which are located just off the Caribbean coast of Eastern Panama. The indigenous Kuna Yala tribe have self governing authority over the islands.

Name: Taboga
Description: Taboga is an island in Central Panama. It is one of the favorite escapes for residents of Panama City, who enjoy the beach, hiking, nature, fishing, and boat charters. The island has a charming village with a whitewashed church, a few narrow streets with several small restaurants, small hotels and great views to Panama City from the highest point on the island which stands at approximately 300 m.

Name: Volcan Barú
Description: Volcano Baru or Volcan Barú is in Chiriqui Province of the Pacific West in Panama.
